rollbar.init(access_token, environment='production', **kw)[source]¶

Saves configuration variables in this module’s SETTINGS and initializes any resources. Should only be called once; calls after the first call have no effect.

Parameters:
  • access_token: the project access token. Get this from the Rollbar UI:
    1. click “Settings” in the top nav
    2. click “Projects” in the left nav
    3. copy-paste the appropriate token (probably the post_server_item token).

  • environment: environment name. Can be any string; suggestions: ‘production’, ‘development’, ‘staging’, ‘yourname’

  • **kw: additional configuration; provided keyword arguments will override keys in SETTINGS

rollbar.report_exc_info(exc_info, request=None, extra_data=None, payload_data=None, **kw)[source]¶

Reports an exception to Rollbar, using exc_info (from calling sys.exc_info())

Parameters:

  • exc_info: the result of calling sys.exc_info()

  • request: optional, a WebOb or Werkzeug-based request object.

  • extra_data: optional, will be included in the ‘custom’ section of the payload

  • payload_data: optional, dict that will override values in the final payload

    (e.g. ‘level’ or ‘fingerprint’)

  • **kw: provided for legacy purposes; will override arguments in extra_data

Example usage:

try:
    do_something()
except:
    rollbar.report_exc_info(sys.exc_info(), request, {'foo': 'bar'}, {'level': 'warning'})
rollbar.report_message(message, level='error', request=None, extra_data=None, payload_data=None)[source]¶

Reports an arbitrary string message to Rollbar.

Parameters:
  • message: the string body of the message
  • level: level to report at. One of: ‘critical’, ‘error’, ‘warning’, ‘info’, ‘debug’
  • request: the request object for the context of the message
  • extra_data: dictionary of params to include with the message. ‘body’ is reserved.
  • payload_data: param names to pass in the ‘data’ level of the payload; overrides defaults.

Example usage:

rollbar.report_message('Could not get user data from Facebook API', 'warning', request, extra_data={'user_id': 12345})
rollbar.send_payload(payload)[source]¶

Sends a fully-formed payload (i.e. a string from json.dumps()). Uses the configured handler from SETTINGS[‘handler’]

Available handlers:
  • 'blocking': calls _send_payload() (which makes an HTTP request) immediately, blocks on it
  • 'thread': starts a single-use thread that will call _send_payload(). returns immediately.
Parameters:
  • payload: a json-encoded payload ready to be sent to the Rollbar /item API.
